greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = abs( A104509(n-1,n-k) ).
comment: The old definition was: "Companion Pell polynomials, as a triangle."
formula: G.f.: (1 + x^2)/(1-x-x^2 - x*y) (columns in reverse order). - _Georg Fischer_, Aug 13 2019
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
Row 3: (1, 2, 3); as (x^2 + 2x + 3) = f(x), (x=1,2,3...) of column 3 of A309220: (6, 11, 18, 27, 38, 51...). The latter sequence = binomial transform of row 3 of A118980: (6, 5, 2).
mathematica: Flatten[Map[Reverse,CoefficientList[CoefficientList[Series[(1 + x^2)/(1-x-x^2 - x*y), {x,0,8}], x], y]]] (* _Georg Fischer_, Aug 13 2019 *)
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, May 07 2006
ext: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 12 2019, replacing old definition by explicit formula from _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 30 2011.
